V depresiji, ker ni sonca
Sezonska razpoloženjska motnja se pojavlja skorajda izključno v zimskih mesecih, in to iz leta v leto.
05 Nov 2019, 07:53 by M. M. K.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOZimska depresija izbruhne novembra, ko se zmanjša količina dnevne svetlobe, vrh doseže januarja in februarja.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOMotnjo zdravimo s pogovornimi terapijami, denimo vedenjsko-kognitivno terapijo. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOPoskrbite za dovolj gibanja, tudi v dežju se odpravite na sprehod.


Depresija je poleg tesnobnosti najpogostejša duševna motnja. Prizadene lahko vsakogar – mlajše, starejše, moške in ženske. Kot ocenjujejo strokovnjaki, bo vsaj enkrat v življenju za njo zbolela vsaka šesta oseba, ta trenutek pa je depresiven vsak dvajseti med nami.Čeprav je danes znanje o njej izjemno napredovalo, se še vedno prevečkrat zgodi, da jo spregledamo tako laiki kot tudi strokovnjaki. Neprepoznana ali nepravilno obravnavana depresija pomeni trpljenje za posameznika, ki ga lahko konča tudi s samomorom, opozarjajo na Nacionalnem inštitutu za javno zdravje (NIJZ).


Motnjo zdravimo s pogovornimi terapijami, denimo vedenjsko-kognitivno terapijo. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Po definiciji pomeni duševno motnjo, ki prizadene človekovo razpoloženje, njegove misli, čustva, vedenje in telo in posledično vpliva na njegovo delovanje v krogu družine in zunaj nje. Kadar zbolimo, se v delu možganov, ki uravnava razpoloženje, poruši ravnovesje kemičnih prenašalcev, ki v možganih prenašajo sporočila med celicami.Depresija je bolezen, za katero sta značilni dolgotrajna žalost in izguba zanimanja za dejavnosti, v katerih običajno uživamo, ob tem pa je ovirano naše delovanje, ko s težavo poskrbimo za vsakdanja opravila. Psihologi opozarjajo, da če zaradi hude žalosti ali nesposobnosti nismo sposobni opravljati vsakodnevnih opravil, se nismo sposobni razveseliti, opuščamo pomembne dejavnosti, razmišljamo, da življenje nima več nobenega smisla in da je vse v prihodnosti črno, in če to traja štirinajst dni, je vsekakor treba poiskati pomoč zdravnika.Pomagajmo si samiDa se v dnevih brez sončne svetlobe ne bi počutili slabo, si lahko poskušamo pomagati, a ne z alkoholom in kofeinom, saj lahko stanje še poslabšamo. Raje poskusimo z zdravo prehrano, zlasti zelenjavo in sadjem, privoščimo si ogljikove hidrate, tuno in česen. Dovolj moramo popiti, predvsem vode, pa tudi zeliščnih čajev, ter biti primerno telesno aktivni, saj vadba preganja slabo voljo. In tudi dovolj spanca si moramo privoščiti, če ga je premalo, nismo le slabe volje, smo še razdražljivi in se ne moremo dobro osredotočiti na delo.Osebe z depresijo se običajno soočajo z izgubo energije, spremembo teka in spanja, tesnobo, zmanjšano zmožnostjo koncentracije, neodločnostjo, nemirom, občutkom nevrednosti, krivdo, brezupom, mislimi na samopoškodovanje ali samomor. 
Ko je krivo vreme
Poleg tipične depresije je pogosta atipična oziroma tako imenovana zimska depresija, ki jo strokovnjaki imenujejo sezonska razpoloženjska motnja. Večina ljudi je v zimskem času slabše razpoložena, nekatere pa doleti tudi prava depresija. Za sezonsko razpoloženjsko motnjo so značilni dolgotrajna brezvoljnost, slabša koncentracija, pomanjkanje energije, povečana želja po sladkem, še posebno v večernih urah, upade pa tudi spolni nagon.Med simptomi so utrujenost, jokavost, telesne bolečine in povečanje telesne teže. Kot pravijo psihologi, gre pri zimski depresiji za motnjo razpoloženja, ki obsega vsakoletno doživljanje depresivne epizode v zimskih mesecih, ko je manj naravne sončne svetlobe. Razlika med zimsko in tipično depresijo v tem, da se prva pojavlja skorajda izključno v zimskih mesecih in se ponavlja iz leta v leto. Najpogosteje izbruhne novembra, ko se pomembno zmanjša količina dnevne svetlobe, vrh doseže januarja in februarja, umiri pa se s prihodom sončnih dni.
Zelo pomembno je, da znake depresije pozna čim več ljudi, ki bodo lahko trpečega usmerili k virom pomoči.
Za diagnozo sezonska depresija se mora ta vsaj dvakrat zapored ponoviti v enakem časovnem obdobju, pravijo strokovnjaki na NIJZ. Sezonska depresija povzroča veliko trpljenje ter lahko zelo ovira življenje in delo. Ljudje s to motnjo se pogosto odmaknejo od prijateljev, le stežka dokončajo preproste naloge in so zelo razdražljivi, zaradi česar se zapletajo v konfliktne situacije. Brez zdravljenja lahko ta motnja zelo slabo vpliva na življenje posameznika. 
Treba jo je zdraviti
Ne glede na to, za kakšno motnjo razpoloženja gre, sezonsko ali tipično depresijo, jo je treba zdraviti, pravijo psihologi. Danes je na voljo več učinkovitih načinov zdravljenja, ki se prepletajo. Zdravijo jo s pogovornimi terapijami, to so različne oblike psihoterapije, kot sta vedenjsko-kognitivna terapija in svetovanje. Zdravijo jo tudi z zdravili – antidepresivi.


Poskrbite za dovolj gibanja, tudi v dežju se odpravite na sprehod.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Najpogosteje pa jo zdravijo s kombinacijo obeh načinov, torej tako z zdravili kot s psihoterapijo. Tako antidepresivi kot prijetne dejavnosti povečujejo delovanje tistih delov možganov, ki so zaradi motenega ravnovesja kemičnih prenašalcev premalo aktivni. Zdravljenje je odvisno od trajanja in globine; blage depresije lahko izzvenijo same, pri hujših oblikah pa se stanje poglablja, znaki se množijo in večajo težave, posameznik jih ne obvlada več. Takrat se običajno poišče pomoč.
Pomanjkanje svetlobe povzroča zmanjšanje izločanja serotonina, hormona sreče, ki vpliva na boljše razpoloženje.
Prvi korak je pregled pri zdravniku. Depresiven človek se za obisk pogosto ne odloči sam, bodisi ker ne prepozna svojih težav bodisi ker meni, da mu ni pomoči. Zato je izjemno pomembno, pravijo na NIJZ, da znake pozna čim več ljudi, ki bodo lahko posameznika usmerili k virom pomoči.

Depressed because there is no sun
Seasonal mood disorder occurs almost exclusively during the winter months, year after year.
05 Nov 2019, 07:53 by M. M. K.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOWinter depression erupts in November as daylight diminishes and peaks in January and February.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTTo treat disorder with conversational therapies, such as behavioral cognitive therapy. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTProvide enough movement, even in the rain, take a walk.


In addition to anxiety, depression is the most common mental disorder. It can affect anyone - younger, older, male and female. According to experts, at least one in six people will get sick at least once in their lives, and this moment is depressing for every twentieth of us. Unrecognized or improperly treated depression means suffering for an individual who may also end up committing suicide, the National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) has warned.


The disorder is treated with talk therapy, such as behavioral-cognitive therapy. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

By definition, it means a mental disorder that affects the human mood, his thoughts, emotions, behavior and body and consequently affects his functioning within and outside the family. When we get sick, the mood-regulating part of our brain disrupts the balance of the chemical carriers that carry messages across the brain. Depression is a disease characterized by long-term sadness and loss of interest in activities we typically enjoy, impeded our functioning when we have difficulty in taking care of our daily tasks. Psychologists point out that if we are unable to perform our daily tasks because of severe grief or incapacity, we are unable to rejoice, we abandon important activities, think that life no longer makes sense and that everything is black in the future, and if it lasts for fourteen days, it is definitely We need to seek the help of a doctor. We prefer to try a healthy diet, especially vegetables and fruits, and enjoy carbohydrates, tuna and garlic. We need to drink enough, especially water, as well as herbal teas, and be appropriately physically active, as exercise overrides bad mood. And we also have to afford enough sleep, if we have too little, we are not only ill-willed, we are still irritable and unable to focus well on our work. , indecision, restlessness, feelings of unworthiness, guilt, hopelessness, thoughts of self-harm or suicide.
Who's the wrong time
In addition to typical depression, atypical or so-called winter depression, commonly referred to as seasonal mood disorder, is common. Most people are in a bad mood in the winter, and some are also depressed. Seasonal mood disorders are characterized by long-term moodlessness, lower concentration, lack of energy, increased desire for sweet, especially in the evening, as well as decreased sex drive. Symptoms include fatigue, crying, body aches and weight gain. According to psychologists, winter depression is a mood disorder that involves experiencing a depressive episode every year during the winter months when there is less natural sunlight. The difference between winter and typical depression is that it occurs almost exclusively during the winter months and recurs year after year. Most often it erupts in November, when the amount of daylight decreases significantly, peaks in January and February, and subsides with the arrival of sunny days.
It is very important that there are as many people as possible aware of the signs of depression, who will be able to direct the suffering to sources of help.
For a diagnosis of seasonal depression, it must be repeated at least twice in a row over the same period of time, say experts at the NIJZ. Seasonal depression causes a great deal of suffering and can greatly hinder life and work. People with this disorder often move away from friends, find it difficult to complete simple tasks and are very irritable, causing them to get into conflict situations. Without treatment, this disorder can have a very bad impact on an individual's life.
She needs to be treated
No matter what the mood disorder, seasonal or typical depression, it needs to be treated, psychologists say. Today, there are several effective treatments that are intertwined. She is treated with talk therapies, which are various forms of psychotherapy such as behavioral cognitive therapy and counseling. She is also treated with medications - antidepressants.


Get enough movement, even in the rain, take a walk.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

Most often, however, it is treated with a combination of both, both medication and psychotherapy. Both antidepressants and pleasant activities increase the activity of those parts of the brain that are underactive due to the impaired balance of chemical transporters. Treatment depends on duration and depth; Mild depressions can resolve on their own, with more severe forms, the condition deepens, the signs multiply and the problems increase, and the individual no longer masks them. That's when help is usually sought.
Lack of light causes a decrease in the secretion of serotonin, a happiness hormone that affects better mood.
The first step is to see your doctor. A depressed person often does not choose to visit himself either because he does not recognize his problems or because he thinks that he is not helped. Therefore, it is extremely important, they say at the NIJZ, that as many people as possible know the signs, which will be able to direct an individual to sources of help.
